numismatic_provenance_s: Pegasi Numismatics, Ann Arbor, MI; 10/11/2000; IV (260)
issue_obverse_figure_s: Right profile of Kawad I on frontal bust
issue_obverse_figure_description_s: With Whiskers only, crown with two mural elements, crescent above forehead, above covered korymbos; two ribbons commencing to the left below crescent, pointing upwards, double pearl diadem, diadem ribbons commencing to the left and right behind right shoulder; pointing upwards; earing consisting of three elements; neck-line of tunica edged with row of pearls; crescent on both shoulders; double row of pearls running from the shoulders to the breast (varying decoration); star in left upper field; rigged border
issue_reverse_figure_description_s: base consisting of three elements; round altar shaft; to the left and right of the shaft ribbons pointing downwards, three altar slabs; altar flames rendered in four tiers of four, three, two and one strokes respectively; star to the left of altar flames, crescent to the right; to the left and the right of altar attendant with stylized crown of Kawad I, right hand raised, both figures facing inwards; 	 Kw’t at 9 h; ridged border
